metadata.title: An Interesting Mode of Feeding of Snow Crabs, Chionoecetes spp. (Crustacea, Decapoda, Majidae), on the ascidian Halocynthia aurantium

creators.name: Fisheries, Russian Federal Research Institute of Marine

metadata.description:
The paper presents the first illustrated description of cases when ascidians
     were observed on pointed cheliped digits of the crabs Chionoecetes bairdi
     and C. opilio. This phenomenon was most often observed in the eastern
     Olutorsk Bay and the western Bering Sea. The digits entered the ascidian
     bodies through their siphon openings. C. bairdi with ascidians accounted for
     about 0.25% of the crabs caught by commercial crab pots whereas C. opilio
     with ascidians occurred much more rarely, which may be due to the fact that
     the digits in the former are more curved than in the latter.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To report on an  interesting mode of feeding of snow crabs, Chionoecetes spp. (Crustacea, Decapoda, Majidae), on the ascidian Halocynthia aurantium
